Articles.Content:
Come on, we need this shipping- they would be the most bad-ass couple ever.

Seriously.

(I'm going to hell for this)

First, we have to find out whether they're brother and sister or distant cousins, otherwise there'll be a catastrophic failure during reentry (If you know what I mean. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))

> 
> First, we have to find out whether they're brother and sister or distant cousins, otherwise there'll be a catastrophic failure during reentry (If you know what I mean. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))

I don't get it....

> 
> First, we have to find out whether they're brother and sister or distant cousins, otherwise there'll be a catastrophic failure during reentry (If you know what I mean. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))

**re**-*entry..* did it already go catastrophic?
Jeb and Val doesn't match... Val and Bob is a better combination... love works like magnetism somehow... ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

> 
> First, we have to find out whether they're brother and sister or distant cousins, otherwise there'll be a catastrophic failure during reentry (If you know what I mean. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif))

They'd be one hot couple.

Get it?

*Hot?*

Mkay.

> 
> we need this shipping

Not in my headcanon we don't.

> 
> (I'm going to hell for this)

Oh definitely.

Going to copy my other post from the Kron mission pages about this topic:

EDIT:

Personally, I either find that disturbing or regular depending on which of my saves I played last. In one of them my head canon is that jeb bill and bob are triplets and val I their kid sister. In the other Kerman is a title meaning that you are part of the space program and not a last name, and that jeb and Val are in a thing.

> 
> Come on, we need this shipping- they would be the most bad-ass couple ever.
> Seriously.
> 
> (I'm going to hell for this)

They're siblings! Ick!

Uh... don't kerbals do the fragmentation thing anyway? Or was it parthenogenesis?

Edit: sneaky false dichotomy ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

> 
> They're siblings! Ick!

What sort of self respecting Kerbal parents name give one child an old fashioned, one might even say Amish, and the other a Slavic/Russian name? Preposterous.

Kerman is their clan name... there are other clans on Kerbin... Kaklyan from the West and Kopolovit from the North...

no... wait...

only those to successfully go into space and return having seen kerbin as a blue marble are granted citizenship thus the right to breed

thus meaning widely distributed regional names mean little

saddly the hopefuls who see kerbin more as a rushing green blob growing bigger by the second..

dont exactly get to be parents..but..it matters not..thier only dust in the wind
there all clones they have no need for sexual relationships.

> 
> [they're] only dust in the wind

I see what you did there.
I totally agree with this. They should be the best of friends!
In my headcanon Val is a combo of Valentina Terichova and Sallly Ride, so Val has a girlfriend back home.
they all have the same last name so what does it matter?
I put them on a 4 year mission to Eve and back together in a 2 man capsule. Any hint of romantic engagement between them was gone after the first two weeks.

Jeb's only love is space. 

Now, Bill/Bob, there is a romance for the stars!

at least in my headcannon
If they have to dispose of waste the same way they did back in the old Gemini days, then trust me there is absolutely no romance going on. And if there was before, DEFINATELY not after.

> 
> If they have to dispose of waste the same way they did back in the old Gemini days, then trust me there is absolutely no romance going on. And if there was before, DEFINATELY not after.

In good times and in bad.

If Val is anything like Starbucks from the new Battlestar Galactica series ...

> 
> What sort of self respecting Kerbal parents name give one child an old fashioned, one might even say Amish, and the other a Slavic/Russian name? Preposterous.

My great grandparents had a son named John and a son named Ivan.

Okay I made up that story.
Right. That's enough incest, reproduction, and excretion references for a while. Let's talk about something else, please.
